snippet: The aid, $250 million over the next two years, is an effort to stand up to China’s increasingly aggressive claims on the South China Sea.
abstract: Pres Obama, visiting Asian allies, says United States will contribute extra $250 million over next two years to bolster maritime security in Southeast Asia; aid is message to China over its increasingly aggressive moves in South China Sea..
lead_paragraph: The aid, $250 million over the next two years, is an effort to stand up to China’s increasingly aggressive claims on the South China Sea.

headline.main: With China in Mind on a Visit to Manila, Obama Pledges Military Aid to Allies in Southeast Asia
headline.print_headline: China in Mind, Obama Announces Military Aid to Southeast Asia Allies

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
